5691	5691		Cameraria ohridella Deschka & Dimić, 1986	Animalia	Insecta	Lepidoptera		Cameraria		ohridella	species	Deschka & Dimić, 1986	accepted	Very common in parks and lanes where *Aesculus hippocastanum* is planted, causing severe damage. This species was relatively described very late (1986) from SE Europe from where it spread westwards at a speed of ca 200 km per year. It was discovered in Belgium in 1999 at Tervuren (BR) and in the same year searches for the mines in OV and WV were negative. <br>In 2000, however, the species reached the Belgian coast.  After that, the species became spread all over the country and it is sometimes present in huge quantities and is now considered as a pest species.	2021-04-10	en	Host plant / substrate data / life stage details / ... are also available, see https://projects.biodiversity.be/lepidotera	https://projects.biodiversity.be/lepidoptera/species/5691

6160	6160		Elachista metella Kaila, 2002	Animalia	Insecta	Lepidoptera		Elachista		metella	species	Kaila, 2002	accepted	This species was described new to science in 2002 and belongs to the *Elachista cingillella* complex. After investigation by L. Kaila & J. Junnilainen, this complex consists of 6 valid species. All references to *Elachista cingillella* from southern Europe and Belgium in fact concern *Elachista metella*.<br>  Recorded from the province of NA as *Elachista cingillella* based on three male specimens which were caught at Belvaux on 26.v.1980, leg. & gen. det. G. & W. De Prins. During 2019 two specimens were collected near Resteigne (LX) and Modave (LG).<br>  Hitherto a very rare and local species.	2021-04-23	en	Host plant / substrate data / life stage details / ... are also available, see https://projects.biodiversity.be/lepidotera	https://projects.biodiversity.be/lepidoptera/species/6160

4569	4569		Caradrina kadenii (Freyer, 1836)	Animalia	Insecta	Lepidoptera		Caradrina	Platyperigea	kadenii	species	(Freyer, 1836)	accepted	The first observation of this xerothermic species in Belgium was on 08 July 2006 in the province of WV.<br> During 2007 there were about 10 different observations in 5 new localities. Around 2010 more and more observations in our country became known.<br> The species is extending its range northwards, especially in the western part (France, Switzerland) and is recently discovered in the UK (2002), Germany (2002) and in The Netherlands (2006). During autumn 2005 there were several observations not far (35 km) from the Belgian border in France.<br> Nowadays it is a fairly common species throughout Belgium, more observed in the northern part.	2020-02-21	en	Host plant / substrate data / life stage details / ... are also available, see https://projects.biodiversity.be/lepidotera	https://projects.biodiversity.be/lepidoptera/species/4569

About 2 months later the first imago was trapped in LI. This pest species is an introduction to Europe with imported *Buxus* plants. 4083	4083		Lithosia quadra (Linnaeus, 1758)	Animalia	Insecta	Lepidoptera		Lithosia		quadra	species	(Linnaeus, 1758)	accepted	A very rare species in Belgium, mostly known from the southern provinces. Used to be known from some localities in the north, but on 13 September 2006, there was a great influx of this species all over the country. It was observed again in BR (formerly only known from literature) and in AN. (last observation was in 1951!) and the species was new for the provinces of LI and WV.<br>A species that sometimes can occur in great numbers with migratory movements.
